description: Whether using for personal email or work email as large business organization, this course covers everything one needs to become a skilled and informed user of Microsoft Outlook 2016. Our hosts start with explaining the basic terminology and setup of email accounts and continue on to all areas of Outlook including managing email, contacts, calendars, and tasks. This course is specifically for Windows operating system with Outlook 2016 locally installed.
descriptionMD: Whether using for personal email or work email as large business organization, this course covers everything one needs to become a skilled and informed user of Microsoft Outlook 2016. Our hosts start with explaining the basic terminology and setup of email accounts and continue on to all areas of Outlook including managing email, contacts, calendars, and tasks. This course is specifically for Windows operating system with Outlook 2016 locally installed.
name: Outlook 2016
subtitle: Personal information management application

episodes.description: Whether using for personal email or work email as large business organization, this course covers everything one needs to become a skilled and informed user of Microsoft Outlook 2016. Our hosts start with explaining the basic terminology and setup of email accounts and continue on to all areas of Outlook including managing email, contacts, calendars, and tasks. This course is specifically for Windows operating system with Outlook 2016 locally installed.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne briefly discuss Outlook’s job, history and presence in our connected society.  Vonne describes that outlook as product appears in multiple formats:  as a standalone product, as consumer based web-based portal and even as a custom access web portal for a company’s email.  She talks little of the where outlook began and where it is today as well as describing the configuration that will be used for the show.
episodes.title: Introduction to Outlook

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne discuss some of the different protocols used when transmitting and receiving emails.  Vonne discusses the basic difference between a client and server.  Also, she provides a brief description of emailing protocols like POP3, IMAP, MAPI and SMTP too.
episodes.title: Email Terminology

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne show how to get an email account setup on outlook.  They demonstrate the dialog boxes you’ll see during a routine setup. She then shows how to do a manual setup within outlook as well.  Lastly, she discusses the process of removing an account from outlook.
episodes.title: Setup Email Account

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne take a dive into outlook interface to help the user become familiar with the outlook interface. Vonne demonstrates that the interface can change and even how to customize the quick access toolbar as well as create a custom user tab for tools that user may want readily available without having to search among the different tabs and ribbons.
episodes.title: Outlook Interface

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne introduce the email interface.  Vonne navigates through the majority of the different views, folders panes and tools.  The team also describes some of the uses of the different folders too.  Vonne also describes the uses and the different way that we can customize the interface for a user to manage their own email client to suit himself/herself.
episodes.title: Email Interface

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore working with the Focused inbox option in Outlook 2016. Here you will learn what Focused inbox is and how to enable or disable it. They also discuss how the Focused inbox relates to the Clutter option in previous versions.
episodes.title: Focused Inbox

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne introduce emailing basics a single recipient.  They demonstrate the use of the email addresses and subject line.  They also show how to attach files to an email as well as receive them to view or save.  They also show how to change to conversation view to see the messages and replies in the chronology they were sent.
episodes.title: Email Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne continue with some emailing basics with multiple recipients.  They establish the use of CC and the BCC when sending emails.   Vonne emphasizes the use of BBC should be a conscious choice.  She also shows and explains the use of forwarding emails along with the use of email drafts too.
episodes.title: Email Basics Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne take a look a few additional emailing features users can take advantage of to help them.  They examine two undeliverable message to show the information they provide for troubleshooting.  They also show how to add multiple attachments using a couple of different methods.  Vonne discusses the use of the deleted items folder and lastly some of the common messages that we when the email messages are missing elements.
episodes.title: Email Basics Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne show some different ways to format the messages that we send out from Outlook 2016.  Vonne takes the time to differentiate character and paragraph level formatting.  She continues by showing some of the built in “auto” features that Outlook automatically does to help your email composition remains professional (AutoCorrect, AutoFormat, Spelling and Grammar Checking).
episodes.title: Format Message Body

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne continue with some additional formatting options available in Outlook 2016.  Vonne shows additional elements likes tables, smarter, shapes, picture and even screenshots.  She continues to demonstrate some of the additional copy and paste options.  The team also shows some additional legacy elements like stationary.  Lastly, she demonstrates the results of changing the format from HTML to Plain Text.
episodes.title: Format Message Body Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne begin looking at advanced email features found in Outlook 2016. Here they look over advanced features specific to the sender. You'll see options like Importance, Security, Delivery and Read Receipts, and Voting buttons.
episodes.title: Advanced Email Features

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue looking at advanced email features found in Outlook 2016. Here they look over advanced features specific to the receiving client. You'll see options like Importance, Read receipts, Expires, and Voting buttons.
episodes.title: Advanced Email Features Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue looking at advanced email features found in Outlook 2016. Here they will finish with the 2 advanced options, Recall and Mention.
episodes.title: Advanced Email Features Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to create an email signature in Outlook 2016. Here they will define what an email signature is and then proceed to walking you step-by-step through creating one and adding it to your message body.
episodes.title: Signatures

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne look at tools and functions that aid in organizing, customizing, and searching in Outlook 2016. Watch as they demonstrate Reading Pane settings, creating folders, and cleaning up/deleting email.
episodes.title: Organize, Customize and Search

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne look at tools and functions that aid in organizing, customizing, and searching in Outlook 2016. Here they cover using the View tab, Preview views, and Grouping, as well as using the Search bar.
episodes.title: Organize, Customize and Search Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore employing rules and automation to reduce the time needed to complete repetitive tasks and increase productivity. Watch here as they explain and demonstrate Quick Parts, Quick Steps, Tap, Rules, and Out-of-Office replies.
episodes.title: Rules and Automation

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne take a look at handling junk mail within Outlook 2016.  They discuss what junk mail is and where it’s controlled for Outlook 2016. They also show the Junk Mail Options that users can setup to help handle junk mail that may get through the administrative handling of it too.
episodes.title: Junk Mail

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne explain archiving emails in Outlook 2016.  They cover a range of archiving topics including sending email messages to archive folder, changing the location of your archive folder, auto archive settings, and .pst and .ost data files .
episodes.title: Setup Mailbox Archiving

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne dive into sharing and managing multiple email accounts in Outlook 2016. Here they demonstrate and explain how to setup email delegation to grant access as well as viewing the delegated inbox in the Outlook client. They also cover need to know characteristics that happen when managing a shared account.
episodes.title: Share and Manage Multiple Accounts

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne begin exploring the use of contacts in Outlook 2016. Here they will start at the beginning by describing what a contact is, how to create a contact, and edit an existing contact, as well as creating a contact group and printing contacts.
episodes.title: Create and Manage Contacts

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne take a look at sharing and/or transferring contacts. Watch as they show you how to forward a contact, sharing by asking for access or providing permissions, and finally importing/exporting contacts as a .csv file.
episodes.title: Share and Transfer Contacts

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne spend some time familiarizing you with the Calendar found in Outlook 2016. Here they walk you through calendar arrangement, reminders, hover details, custom calendars, and sharing calendars.
episodes.title: Calendar Interface

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Vonne take a look at creating and managing appointments inside of Outlook. They discuss creating a new appointment, the attributes of the appointment, recurring appointments as well as editing, forwarding and moving appointments.
episodes.title: Create and Manage Appointments

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Vonne take a look at creating and managing meetings inside of Outlook. They look at creating a new meeting, as well as meeting attributes, editing, changing the properties of a meeting and the various responses to meeting invitation.
episodes.title: Create and Manage Meetings

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Vonne take a look at sharing and transferring calendars inside, from and to, Outlook. They look at forwarding, sharing, importing, exporting and publishing a calendar.
episodes.title: Share and Transfer Calendars

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Vonne continue their discussion on sharing and transferring calendars. They look at various topics like forwarding, sharing, importing, exporting and publishing a calendar.
episodes.title: Share and Transfer Calendars Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Vonne take a look at tasks and notes inside of Outlook 2016. They discuss the interface, arrangement, columns, view settings and more. They demonstrate creating, updating, assigning as well as forwarding tasks. They also will talk about notes inside of Outlook.
episodes.title: Tasks and Notes

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Vonne take a look at groups inside of Outlook. They describe what groups are used for, creating, deleting and modifying groups as well as the resources available to members of groups.
episodes.title: Groups
